summary: The document is a memorandum dated 3 February 1969, addressed to the Office of the General Counsel, discussing the relationship between covert operations and Itkin, with a focus on Thomas Lee Roberts and the Itkin Case. It details Roberts' development of potential cover company business with interests from the United States and England, his financial involvement with a firm prior to his association with the Agency, and an agreement he entered into in 1961.
key_findings: The memorandum highlights the connection between covert operations and Itkin, emphasizing Thomas Lee Roberts' role.
Roberts was exploring potential cover company business opportunities with U.S. and English interests by 1966.
Prior to his Agency association, Roberts had financial ties to a firm and was part of a 1961 agreement.
